intro: Radlkoferella urbanii, commonly known as the urbanii rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub characterized by its compact form and dense foliage. The plant produces small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Radlkoferella urbanii thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
